newsitem.title: FRANCE: Simco sees 1996 profit in line with '95.
newsitem.headline: Simco sees 1996 profit in line with '95.

text.p: French property company Simco forecast on Thursday that its 1996 profit would be in line with the 368 million franc profit it made in 1995.
The profit "will be around the same size as in 1995," company chairman Georges Mazaud told a news conference.
Simco, forecasting a gradual recovery of the French real estate market in 1997, said it was expecting external growth to preserve its high returns.
The group, which fared relatively well during France's property slump, said it expected to maintain its dividend distribution policy through a planned acquisition which it did not specify.
To carry out its growth plans, the group planned to borrow between one billion and 1.5 billion francs, managing director Jean-Paul Sorand said.
